resources.string: Take Off?
Ensure that conditions are safe for takeoff. Aircraft will go to an altitude of %1$s and hover.
Positioning failed. The aircraft will automatically fly to %1$s above the ground. Do not take off in a narrow space or near crowd or buildings. Do not touch propellers.
Precisely record takeoff point

With Precision Takeoff Mode enabled, the aircraft will automatically ascend to %1$s. This allows the aircraft to return to home point more accurately with VPS images. Ensure there is sufficient ambient light and that the takeoff route isn\'t blocked by trees, power lines or other objects. Moving the sticks during takeoff may affect image acquisition. In an emergency, use the control sticks to throttle downward.
Slide to Take Off
Land?
Aircraft will land at its current location. Check landing area is clear.
Slide to Land
Continue Landing?
Aircraft has descended to %1$s.
Aircraft is hovering low. Ensure the landing point is safe and push the stick downward to land.
Not suitable for landing.
Area is not suitable for landing. Please move to a safer location.
Slide to Force Landing
Return home and land?
Slide to Return Home
The distance between the aircraft and Home Point is less than 65.6 ft (20 m). The aircraft will return home at its current altitude if RTH is initiated.
The aircraft is less than 20 m (65.6 ft) from the Home Point. The aircraft will land if Return to Home is initiated.
Approaching a No-Fly Zone. Current RTH route may be distorted. Monitor the aircraft\'s flight path on the map or visually to ensure safety.
Aircraft will head to home point and set RTH route. Use virtual joystick to adjust flight direction. Tap Cancel RTH button to stop RTH.

Aircraft will adjust its nose direction to face the home point, and its altitude to %1$s. Current aircraft altitude is %2$s. Press Return to Home button directly on your remote to cancel this procedure, or take over control sticks.
